alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 03 at 5:51PM EST until January 03 at 6:30PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EST/530 PM CST/ FOR SOUTHERN HENRY COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN ALABAMA... CLAY...WESTERN CALHOUN AND NORTHWESTERN EARLY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN GEORGIA... At 550 PM EST/450 PM CST/, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles east of Headland, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Headland, Blakely, Edison, Arlington, Columbia, Kinsey, Newville, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Tumbleton, Parksville, Standleys Store, Grandberry Crossroads and Hayes. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EST/800 PM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
